Record.ClassificationPath: Bacterial Infections and Mycoses/Bacterial Infections/Bacteremia/Hemorrhagic Septicemia
Bacterial Infections and Mycoses/Bacterial Infections/Gram-Negative Bacterial Infections/Pasteurellaceae Infections/Pasteurella Infections/Hemorrhagic Septicemia
Pathological Conditions, Signs and Symptoms/Pathologic Processes/Inflammation/Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome/Sepsis/Bacteremia/Hemorrhagic Septicemia
Record.Description: Any of several bacterial diseases, usually caused by PASTEURELLA MULTOCIDA, marked by the presence of hemorrhagic areas in the subcutaneous tissues, serous membranes, muscles, lymph glands, and throughout the internal organs. The diseases primarily affect animals and rarely humans.
